attributes.action: Increase action and funding to improve conditions on TFL services in hot weather
attributes.additional_details: During a hot spell this time last year, the Bakerloo line reached 31.04°C. This could rise even higher with temperatures set to reach 39°C in the current heatwave. The government should set up a select conmittee to tackle this issue, taking into account the environment.
attributes.background: Between the months of May to September, the temperatures on most TFL services are unacceptable and dangerous. More should be done to ensure the safety of london commuters, such as air conditioning and free cold water refill points on platforms. Climate change will only increase this problem.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. This is the responsibility of TfL, which is accountable to the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
